title: How to Turn Off Siri on Apple Devices: Step-by-Step Guide

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Siri & Search.
steps.content: Tap Siri & Search . This may also look like Siri or Apple Intelligence & Siri .

steps.title: Tap "Listen for" and select Off.
steps.content: Tap "Listen for" and select Off . This prevents Siri from responding to this command.

steps.title: Toggle off "Press Side Button for Siri".
steps.content: Toggle off "Press Side Button for Siri". This prevents Siri from activating from a physical button. When both of these options are disabled, Siri is fully disabled.

steps.title: Click the Apple logo.
steps.content: Click the Apple logo. This is in the top-left corner.

steps.title: Click System Settings.
steps.content: Click System Settings . You can find this in the drop-down menu. A new window will open.

steps.title: Click Siri & Spotlight.
steps.content: Click Siri & Spotlight . This may also look like Siri or Apple Intelligence & Siri .

steps.title: Toggle off "Ask Siri".
steps.content: Toggle off "Ask Siri". Siri is now disabled on your Mac device.

steps.title: Open the Settings app on your Apple Watch.
steps.content: Open the Settings app on your Apple Watch. You can also use the Watch app on your connected iPhone or iPad.

steps.title: Tap Siri.
steps.content: Tap Siri . This is towards the top of the menu.

steps.title: Toggle off "Listen for "Hey Siri".
steps.content: Toggle off "Listen for "Hey Siri". This prevents Siri from responding to this command.

steps.title: Toggle off "Raise to Speak".
steps.content: Toggle off "Raise to Speak". This prevents Siri from activating when you lift your watch.

steps.title: Toggle off "Press Digital Crown".
steps.content: Toggle off "Press Digital Crown". This prevents Siri from activating when you press the side button.

steps.title: Tap Turn Off Siri.
steps.content: Tap Turn Off Siri . When the previous options are disabled, this prompt will appear. Siri is now disabled.

steps.title: Connect your AirPods
steps.content: Connect your AirPods to your iPhone or iPad. This is how you'll customize the AirPod's actions.

steps.title: Open the Settings app.
steps.content: Open the Settings app. This is the grey cog icon.

steps.title: Tap your AirPods.
steps.content: Tap your AirPods. You'll see them listed near the top of the page. If you don't see it, tap Bluetooth , and then select the i next to your AirPods.

steps.title: Set "Left" as a non-Siri option.
steps.content: Set "Left" as a non-Siri option. To do this, tap Left and select a new option, such as skip song .

steps.title: Set "Right" as a non-Siri option.
steps.content: Set "Right" as a non-Siri option. To do this, tap Right and select a new option.
